primitive_props.translation: This Confidentiality and Non-Disclosure Agreement is entered into by the Vendor and Boston Public Schools (BPS).
primitive_props.evidence: Opening paragraph: “This Confidentiality and Non-Disclosure Agreement … is entered into by and between … ‘Vendor’ … and the Boston Public Schools … (‘BPS’)”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic statement asserting the parties to the agreement; no logical connectives.

primitive_props.translation: The Agreement refers to the transportation data challenge posted on the BPS website occurring between April 1, 2017 and June 30, 2017.
primitive_props.evidence: Intro: “This Agreement refers to the transportation data challenge posted on the BPS website that will take place between April 1st, 2017 and June 30, 2017.”
primitive_props.explanation: Single factual reference/time-bounding statement.

primitive_props.translation: BPS authorizes only the Vendor and the Vendor’s employees and/or representatives to have access to certain directory, student, and routing information for portions of 2017.
primitive_props.evidence: WHEREAS: “BPS has authorized only the VENDOR and its employees and/or representatives to have access to certain directory, student, and routing information…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic exclusivity authorization claim; no embedded conditions.

primitive_props.translation: BPS will provide only to the Vendor certain directory, student, and routing information subject to the terms of this Agreement.
primitive_props.evidence: WHEREAS: “BPS will provide only to VENDOR certain directory, student, and routing information subject to the terms of this Agreement.”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic commitment about scope of disclosure.

primitive_props.translation: Any individual person or organization identified to receive and utilize the confidential information must be disclosed to and approved by BPS.
primitive_props.evidence: Definitions (Vendor and its employees/representatives): “must be disclosed to and approved by BPS”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic requirement (treated as a single policy statement) without additional connectives.

primitive_props.translation: Any individual person or organization identified to receive and utilize the confidential information must sign this agreement prior to commencing work or participation in the challenge.
primitive_props.evidence: Definitions: “and sign this agreement prior to commencing work on or engaging in participation…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic requirement about signing prior to work.

primitive_props.translation: BPS reserves the right to request proof or copies of signed agreements by any vendor and its employees or representatives at any time.
primitive_props.evidence: Definitions: “BPS reserves the right to request proof or copies of any and all signed agreements…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic statement of BPS right.

primitive_props.translation: Only the Vendor and its employees or representatives will be given or have access to certain directory, routing, and confidential student information (Confidential Information).
primitive_props.evidence: Confidential Information definition: “only VENDOR and its employees or representatives will be given or have access…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic access limitation assertion.

primitive_props.translation: The Vendor agrees to comply fully with federal and state privacy and student record confidentiality laws (including FERPA).
primitive_props.evidence: Confidential Information definition: “VENDOR acknowledges and agrees to comply fully with these federal and state privacy and student record confidentiality laws.”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic compliance obligation statement.

primitive_props.translation: The Vendor and its employees and/or representatives use best efforts to protect the confidentiality of the Confidential Information and prevent disclosure without BPS’s express written consent.
primitive_props.evidence: Confidential Information definition: “shall… use best efforts… to protect… and prevent its disclosure… without the express written consent of BPS.”
primitive_props.explanation: Single obligation statement; “best efforts” is not a hedge but a standard of performance.

primitive_props.translation: The data set includes all City of Boston students eligible for school bus transportation from Boston Public Schools.
primitive_props.evidence: Data Set definition: “The data set includes all City of Boston students eligible for school bus transportation…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic descriptive fact.

primitive_props.translation: In the dataset, specific student information has been changed slightly to protect student confidentiality.
primitive_props.evidence: Data Set definition: “specific student information has been changed slightly to protect student confidentiality.”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic descriptive fact.

primitive_props.translation: Vendors will not be provided with students’ corresponding names or other non-directory information requiring consent under 603 C.M.R. 23.00.
primitive_props.evidence: Routing Information section: “Vendors will not be provided with the students’ corresponding names…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic negative provision stated as a fact about what is provided.

primitive_props.translation: The Vendor maintains and administers a secure database for delivery, evaluation, and reporting purposes.
primitive_props.evidence: B.1 Data Sharing: “VENDOR shall maintain and administer a secure database…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic duty to maintain/administer a secure database.

primitive_props.translation: The Vendor uses a secure database for managing and sharing routing data.
primitive_props.evidence: B.1 Data Sharing: “VENDOR will use a secure database for managing and sharing routing data.”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic use requirement; no explicit condition.

primitive_props.translation: The Database meets government data management and security protocols.
primitive_props.evidence: B.1 Data Sharing: “The Database will meet government data management and security protocols…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic property requirement for the database.

primitive_props.translation: The Database incorporates security features to ensure privacy and confidentiality are maintained.
primitive_props.evidence: B.1 Data Sharing: “will incorporate security features… to ensure privacy and confidentiality is maintained…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic property requirement for the database.

primitive_props.translation: The Vendor (and its employees/representatives) transmits all data (or records of data) requested and received under the Agreement, including confirmation of return or destruction of data.
primitive_props.evidence: B.1 Data Sharing: “shall be responsible for transmitting all data… including confirmation of the return or destruction of data…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic responsibility statement; treated as a single duty described in the clause.

primitive_props.translation: No Party may maintain, use, disclose, or share Confidential Information in a manner not allowed by law or outside the scope of this Agreement.
primitive_props.evidence: B.2 Nondisclosure: “Nothing in this Agreement may be construed to allow any Party to maintain, use, disclose, or share… not allowed… or outside the scope…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic prohibition statement summarizing the clause’s single rule.

primitive_props.translation: The Vendor uses Confidential Information and routing data solely in connection with performing services for BPS as outlined by the Agreement and Challenge Document.
primitive_props.evidence: B.2 Nondisclosure: “shall use… solely in connection with performance… and for no other purpose.”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic purpose limitation.

primitive_props.translation: The Vendor sells, releases, transfers, reprints, duplicates, recreates, discloses, or permits disclosure of Confidential Information (or derived materials) to another person or entity without BPS’s express written consent and compliance with applicable laws.
primitive_props.evidence: B.2 Nondisclosure: “Neither VENDOR nor… shall sell, release, transfer… disclose… without the express written consent of BPS…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic event-description (a prohibited act) without embedding ‘unless’ as a connective in the proposition itself.

primitive_props.translation: The Vendor maintains the privacy of protected personal information.
primitive_props.evidence: B.2 Nondisclosure: “VENDOR shall maintain the privacy of protected personal information…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic obligation.

primitive_props.translation: A security breach relating to protected personal information results from acts or omissions of the Vendor (or its employees/representatives).
primitive_props.evidence: B.2 Nondisclosure: “if and to the extent that any security breach… results from acts or omissions of VENDOR…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic condition/event statement used for responsibility rules.

primitive_props.translation: The Vendor is financially responsible for notifications to affected persons after prompt consultation with BPS (when a Vendor-caused breach occurs).
primitive_props.evidence: B.2 Nondisclosure: “shall be financially responsible… for any notifications to affected persons (after prompt consultation with BPS)…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic responsibility statement.

primitive_props.translation: The Vendor does not permit release of Confidential Information to parties other than BPS officials and their authorized agents.
primitive_props.evidence: B.2 Nondisclosure: “shall not permit the release… to parties other than BPS officials and their authorized agents.”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic prohibition (expressed positively as a ‘does not permit’ rule).

primitive_props.translation: BPS reserves the right to conduct an appropriate background check on participants with access to Confidential Information.
primitive_props.evidence: B.3 Background Checks: “BPS reserves the right to conduct an appropriate background check…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic statement of right.

primitive_props.translation: A subpoena, court order, or other legal process seeks to compel disclosure of Confidential Information.
primitive_props.evidence: B.4 Disclosure Sought Under Legal Process: “any subpoena, court order or other legal process seeking… to compel disclosure…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic triggering event statement.

primitive_props.translation: The Vendor immediately notifies BPS in writing of a subpoena, court order, or other legal process seeking to compel disclosure of Confidential Information.
primitive_props.evidence: B.4: “VENDOR shall immediately notify BPS… in writing…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic notification obligation.

primitive_props.translation: The Vendor challenges, opposes, or appeals the legal process seeking disclosure to the extent deemed appropriate by BPS.
primitive_props.evidence: B.4: “shall challenge, oppose or appeal… to the extent deemed appropriate by BPS.”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic action obligation (extent is referenced but no logical connective).

primitive_props.translation: The Vendor discloses Confidential Information voluntarily in response to legal process without a court order.
primitive_props.evidence: B.4: “In no event shall VENDOR voluntarily, without a court order, disclose…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic description of a (prohibited) type of disclosure.

primitive_props.translation: BPS requests that the Vendor return all or part of the Confidential Information.
primitive_props.evidence: B.6 Return or Destruction: “Upon request of BPS at any time…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic triggering event statement.

primitive_props.translation: The Vendor returns the Confidential Information designated by BPS when requested.
primitive_props.evidence: B.6: “VENDOR shall return all or such part… as BPS may designate…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic required action.

primitive_props.translation: The Vendor’s services for BPS under the Agreement are completed.
primitive_props.evidence: B.6: “upon the completion of the services provided by VENDOR to BPS…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic completion condition.

primitive_props.translation: Upon completion of services, the Vendor returns or destroys all Confidential Information in its possession or control as BPS instructs (including all duplicates/copies and derived materials).
primitive_props.evidence: B.6: “VENDOR shall return or destroy, as BPS may instruct, all Confidential Information…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic post-completion obligation.

primitive_props.translation: BPS has the right to report, present, publish, or otherwise use data it produced or received from the Vendor.
primitive_props.evidence: B.7 Publication: “BPS has the right to report, present, publish, or otherwise use data…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic statement of BPS right.

primitive_props.translation: The Vendor publishes, presents, or uses reports without explicit written consent from BPS.
primitive_props.evidence: B.7: “VENDOR shall not publish, present, or use reports without explicit written consent from BPS.”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic description of a prohibited act (the “without” condition is part of the act-description).

primitive_props.translation: BPS has the right to review and require approval of any publicly reported document prior to its release.
primitive_props.evidence: B.7: “BPS has the right to review and require approval…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic statement of right.

primitive_props.translation: The Vendor gives BPS immediate written and verbal notice of any unauthorized use or disclosure of Confidential Information (or breach/threatened breach) upon learning of it.
primitive_props.evidence: B.10 Immediate Notice: “VENDOR shall give BPS immediate written and verbal notice…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic notification obligation.

primitive_props.translation: The Agreement is entered into in the State of Massachusetts and Massachusetts state courts are the appropriate forum for legal action or injunctive relief under the Agreement.
primitive_props.evidence: B.11 Appropriate Forum: “entered into in the State of Massachusetts… courts… in the State of Massachusetts are the appropriate forum…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic forum-selection statement.

primitive_props.translation: BPS may terminate the agreement with the Vendor at any time for any reason with written or verbal notice.
primitive_props.evidence: B.12 Termination: “BPS may terminate… at any time, for any reason, with either written or verbal notice.”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic statement of BPS discretionary right.

primitive_props.translation: The Vendor terminates the agreement with BPS.
primitive_props.evidence: B.12 Termination: “VENDOR must give… notice of any termination of this agreement with BPS.”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic event statement used to trigger notice duty.

primitive_props.translation: The Vendor gives the designated BPS representative 3-day written and verbal notice of termination.
primitive_props.evidence: B.12: “VENDOR must give… 3-day written and verbal notice…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic required action.

primitive_props.translation: The Vendor indemnifies and holds harmless the City of Boston, BPS, and related persons against claims, liabilities, and costs arising from or connected to the Vendor’s performance (including negligent/reckless/intentional conduct).
primitive_props.evidence: B.13 Indemnification: “VENDOR shall indemnify and hold harmless…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic indemnification obligation statement.

primitive_props.translation: The Vendor (and its employees/representatives) are not employees of BPS.
primitive_props.evidence: B.14 Relationship: “shall not be construed… to be employees… of BPS.”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic status statement.

primitive_props.translation: Nothing in the Agreement creates an agency, association, joint venture, partnership, or employer/employee relationship between BPS and the Vendor.
primitive_props.evidence: B.14: “Nothing herein shall create… any relationship of agency… joint venture… partnership… or employer/employee…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic relationship-negation statement.

primitive_props.translation: Neither party has authority to bind or obligate the other except as expressly provided in the Agreement.
primitive_props.evidence: B.14: “Neither party shall have the authority to bind or obligate the other… except as expressly provided…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic limitation on authority.

primitive_props.translation: A party acts in collusion to circumvent Massachusetts General Laws c. 268A (Conflict of Interest Law).
primitive_props.evidence: B.15 Conflict of Interest: “No party shall act in collusion… to circumvent such law.”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic description of prohibited collusion behavior.

primitive_props.translation: All activity pursuant to the Agreement is in accordance with the Agreement and applicable laws/rules/regulations.
primitive_props.evidence: B.16 Assurances: “all activity pursuant to this Agreement shall be in accordance with this Agreement and all applicable… laws… rules and regulations.”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic global compliance assurance stated as a single proposition.

primitive_props.translation: This Agreement survives termination of the services to be provided by the Vendor (and survives termination of any other agreement between the parties).
primitive_props.evidence: B.17 Termination (survival): “This Agreement shall survive the termination of the services…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic survival clause statement.

primitive_props.translation: The Agreement may be amended, modified, or supplemented only by a written agreement signed by the Vendor and BPS.
primitive_props.evidence: B.19 Entire Agreement; Amendments: “may be amended… only by a written agreement signed by VENDOR and BPS.”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic amendment-form requirement.

primitive_props.translation: If the vendor is not an individual, each individual of that vendor who will be working with the data submits a signed NDA.
primitive_props.evidence: Final sentence: “If the vendor is not an individual, each individual… is required to submit a signed NDA.”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic conditional-policy content captured as a single proposition; used for a conditional constraint.

primitive_props.translation: The vendor is not an individual.
primitive_props.evidence: Final sentence condition: “If the vendor is not an individual…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic status condition enabling the NDA requirement.

primitive_props.translation: The Vendor encrypts all Confidential Information carried on mobile computers/electronic devices.
primitive_props.evidence: B.1 Security precautions (b): “Potentially encrypting all Confidential Information carried on mobile/ computers/electronic/devices.”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic technical safeguard action; stated with hedge 'potentially' in text (handled as soft later).

primitive_props.translation: The Vendor encrypts Confidential Information before it is transmitted electronically.
primitive_props.evidence: B.1 Security precautions (c): “Potentially encrypting Confidential Information before it is transmitted electronically.”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic technical safeguard action; stated with hedge 'potentially' in text (handled as soft later).

primitive_props.translation: The Vendor ensures that users are uniquely identified and authenticated before accessing Confidential Information.
primitive_props.evidence: B.1 Security precautions (d): “Requiring that users be uniquely identified and authenticated…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic security safeguard; appears inside a non-exhaustive list.

primitive_props.translation: The Vendor establishes and enforces well-defined data privilege rights restricting user access to Confidential Information necessary for job functions.
primitive_props.evidence: B.1 Security precautions (e): “Establishing and enforcing… privilege rights…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic security safeguard; appears inside a non-exhaustive list.

primitive_props.translation: All persons accessing Confidential Information sign a confidentiality agreement and the Vendor maintains copies of signed agreements.
primitive_props.evidence: B.1 Security precautions (f): “Ensuring that all persons accessing… sign… and maintaining copies…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic combined safeguard statement (signing + maintaining copies) as described in a single bullet.

primitive_props.translation: The Vendor secures access to physical areas or electronic devices where sensitive data are stored.
primitive_props.evidence: B.1 Security precautions (g): “Securing access to any physical areas/electronic devices…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic security safeguard; appears inside a non-exhaustive list.

primitive_props.translation: The Vendor installs a firewall to permit or deny network transmissions based on a set of rules.
primitive_props.evidence: B.1 Security precautions (h): “Installing a firewall…”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic security safeguard; appears inside a non-exhaustive list.

primitive_props.translation: The Vendor installs anti-virus software to protect the network.
primitive_props.evidence: B.1 Security precautions (i): “Installing anti-virus software to protect the network.”
primitive_props.explanation: Atomic security safeguard; appears inside a non-exhaustive list.

hard_constraints.translation: If only Vendor (and its employees/representatives) are authorized to access the information, then only Vendor (and its employees/representatives) will have access.
hard_constraints.evidence: WHEREAS authorization clause + Confidential Information definition (“authorized only…”; “only VENDOR… will be given or have access…”)
hard_constraints.reasoning: Semantic alignment: the agreement’s stated authorization and access limitations are consistent and should jointly hold.

hard_constraints.translation: If only Vendor (and its employees/representatives) will have access, then the authorization is only for them.
hard_constraints.reasoning: Semantic equivalence in this contract context: access limitation reflects the authorization regime.

hard_constraints.translation: Individuals identified to receive/utilize confidential information must be disclosed/approved by BPS and must sign the agreement before starting work.
hard_constraints.reasoning: Both are explicit “must” requirements; treated as non-negotiable obligations.

hard_constraints.translation: Vendor complies fully with federal and state privacy and student record confidentiality laws (including FERPA).
hard_constraints.reasoning: Explicitly stated as “acknowledges and agrees to comply fully”.

hard_constraints.translation: Vendor uses best efforts to protect confidentiality and prevent disclosure without BPS’s express written consent.
hard_constraints.reasoning: Explicit “shall … use best efforts … protect … prevent disclosure … without … consent”.

hard_constraints.translation: Vendor must maintain/use a secure database that meets government protocols and incorporates security features to maintain privacy/confidentiality.
hard_constraints.reasoning: Each is stated with “shall/will” as binding database/security requirements.

hard_constraints.translation: No Party may use/disclose/share confidential information outside law or outside the agreement scope.
hard_constraints.reasoning: This is a core non-disclosure scope limitation stated as a strict rule.

hard_constraints.translation: Vendor uses confidential information solely for performing services for BPS under the agreement/challenge documents.
hard_constraints.evidence: B.2 Nondisclosure (“solely… and for no other purpose”)
hard_constraints.reasoning: Explicit sole-purpose restriction.

hard_constraints.translation: If the Vendor uses the data solely for the agreed services, then its use is within the agreement scope.
hard_constraints.reasoning: Semantic entailment: “solely for performance … under this agreement” is a way of satisfying the scope-limitation rule.

hard_constraints.translation: Vendor must not disclose/transfer/etc. confidential information (or derived materials) without BPS’s express written consent and legal compliance.
hard_constraints.evidence: B.2 Nondisclosure (“Neither VENDOR nor… shall… without the express written consent…”)
hard_constraints.reasoning: Direct prohibition stated with “shall not”/“neither … shall”.

hard_constraints.translation: Vendor shall maintain the privacy of protected personal information.
hard_constraints.reasoning: Explicit “shall maintain”.

hard_constraints.translation: If a breach results from Vendor acts/omissions, Vendor is financially responsible for notifications (after consultation with BPS).
hard_constraints.reasoning: This is an explicit conditional obligation: responsibility is triggered by a Vendor-caused breach.

hard_constraints.translation: Vendor shall not permit release of confidential information to parties other than BPS officials and their authorized agents.
hard_constraints.reasoning: Explicit prohibition.

hard_constraints.translation: If legal process seeks to compel disclosure, Vendor immediately notifies BPS in writing.
hard_constraints.evidence: B.4 Disclosure Sought Under Legal Process
hard_constraints.reasoning: Explicit “shall immediately notify … in writing”.

hard_constraints.translation: If legal process seeks disclosure, Vendor challenges/opposes/appeals it to the extent deemed appropriate by BPS.
hard_constraints.evidence: B.4 Disclosure Sought Under Legal Process
hard_constraints.reasoning: Explicit “shall challenge, oppose or appeal … to the extent deemed appropriate by BPS”.

hard_constraints.translation: If Vendor discloses voluntarily without a court order in response to legal process, Vendor must at least have notified BPS as required.
hard_constraints.evidence: B.4 (“unless and until VENDOR has given the required notice…”)
hard_constraints.reasoning: The clause makes notice a necessary prerequisite for any such disclosure scenario.

hard_constraints.translation: If BPS requests return of all/part of the confidential information, Vendor returns the part designated by BPS.
hard_constraints.evidence: B.6 Return or Destruction of Materials
hard_constraints.reasoning: Explicit “Upon request … VENDOR shall return… as BPS may designate”.

hard_constraints.translation: Upon completion of services, Vendor returns or destroys all confidential information as BPS instructs.
hard_constraints.evidence: B.6 Return or Destruction of Materials
hard_constraints.reasoning: Explicit post-completion duty.

hard_constraints.translation: Vendor shall not publish/present/use reports without explicit written consent from BPS.
hard_constraints.reasoning: Direct prohibition (“shall not … without … consent”).

hard_constraints.translation: If Vendor terminates the agreement, Vendor gives the designated BPS representative 3-day written and verbal notice.
hard_constraints.reasoning: Explicit “must give … 3-day … notice”.

hard_constraints.translation: Vendor shall indemnify and hold harmless the City of Boston and BPS (and related persons) for claims arising out of Vendor’s performance.
hard_constraints.reasoning: Explicit “shall indemnify and hold harmless”.

hard_constraints.translation: Vendor is not a BPS employee; the agreement creates no agency/joint venture/etc.; neither party can bind the other except as expressly provided.
hard_constraints.reasoning: All are explicit structural limitations on the relationship and authority.

hard_constraints.translation: No party shall act in collusion to circumvent the conflict of interest law.
hard_constraints.reasoning: Explicit prohibition (“No party shall act in collusion…”).

hard_constraints.translation: All activity pursuant to the agreement shall comply with the agreement and applicable laws/rules/regulations.
hard_constraints.reasoning: Explicit “shall be in accordance with”.

hard_constraints.translation: The agreement may be amended only by a written agreement signed by both Vendor and BPS.
hard_constraints.reasoning: Explicit limitation on amendment method.

hard_constraints.translation: If the vendor is not an individual, then each individual of that vendor working with the data submits a signed NDA.
hard_constraints.reasoning: Direct conditional requirement stated in the text.

hard_constraints.translation: Vendors are not provided students’ names or other non-directory information requiring consent.
hard_constraints.evidence: Routing Information section (“Of note, Vendors will not be provided…”)
hard_constraints.reasoning: Explicit fact/constraint about what is shared.

hard_constraints.translation: Massachusetts is the agreed forum; parties consent to Massachusetts courts for actions under the agreement.
hard_constraints.reasoning: Forum selection and consent are explicitly agreed.

hard_constraints.translation: The agreement survives termination of the services and other agreements.
hard_constraints.reasoning: Explicit survival clause.

hard_constraints.translation: Vendor is responsible for transmitting requested/received data and confirmation of return/destruction.
hard_constraints.reasoning: Explicit “shall be responsible for”.

soft_constraints.translation: Vendor encrypts all confidential information carried on mobile/electronic devices.
soft_constraints.evidence: B.1 Security precautions (b) uses hedge: “Potentially encrypting…”
soft_constraints.reasoning: Marked soft because the text explicitly hedges with “Potentially,” indicating it is optional/exampled rather than mandatory.

soft_constraints.translation: Vendor encrypts confidential information before electronic transmission.
soft_constraints.evidence: B.1 Security precautions (c) uses hedge: “Potentially encrypting…”

soft_constraints.translation: Users are uniquely identified and authenticated before accessing confidential information.
soft_constraints.evidence: B.1: “Reasonable security precautions… include, but are not limited to: … Requiring that users be uniquely identified…”
soft_constraints.reasoning: The list is explicitly non-exhaustive (“include, but are not limited to”), so each bullet is best treated as a recommended/illustrative measure rather than a guaranteed mandatory requirement.

soft_constraints.translation: Vendor enforces privilege rights restricting access to necessary confidential information.
soft_constraints.evidence: B.1 security list item (e) under “include, but are not limited to”
soft_constraints.reasoning: Soft for the same reason as S_3 (illustrative list).

soft_constraints.translation: All persons accessing confidential information sign a confidentiality agreement and Vendor maintains copies.
soft_constraints.evidence: B.1 security list item (f) under “include, but are not limited to”
soft_constraints.reasoning: Soft because the clause frames the bullets as examples of reasonable precautions, not necessarily mandatory in all implementations.

soft_constraints.translation: Vendor secures access to physical areas/devices where sensitive data are stored.
soft_constraints.evidence: B.1 security list item (g) under “include, but are not limited to”
soft_constraints.reasoning: Soft as an illustrative security practice.

soft_constraints.translation: Vendor installs a firewall controlling network transmissions.
soft_constraints.evidence: B.1 security list item (h) under “include, but are not limited to”
soft_constraints.reasoning: Soft as an illustrative security practice.

soft_constraints.translation: Vendor installs anti-virus software to protect the network.
soft_constraints.evidence: B.1 security list item (i) under “include, but are not limited to”
soft_constraints.reasoning: Soft as an illustrative security practice.

soft_constraints.translation: If the Vendor discloses confidential information without required consent/compliance, then the Vendor has permitted release beyond BPS officials/agents.
soft_constraints.evidence: Common-sense semantic relationship between B.2 prohibitions (no unauthorized disclosure; no release beyond BPS officials/agents).
soft_constraints.reasoning: This is a plausible entailment, but not logically forced in every conceivable case (e.g., a ‘disclosure’ could be to an authorized agent). Hence soft rather than hard.

soft_constraints.translation: If a Vendor-caused security breach occurs, Vendor gives immediate written and verbal notice to BPS.
soft_constraints.evidence: B.10 Immediate Notice + B.2 breach responsibility clause
soft_constraints.reasoning: B.10 requires notice for unauthorized use/disclosure or breach/threatened breach; P_23 is a particular kind of breach trigger. Mapping P_23 to the B.10 trigger is strongly suggested but not stated with identical wording, so treated as soft.
